name: Loft for 4 by Canal Saint Martin
summary: 100 m2 loft (1100 sq feet) with high ceiling, open modern kitchen, cable tv, wifi, sleeping space up to 5 people, Republique area, 5 minutes from the St Martin Canal, Marais area, 10 min from Chatelet and the Louvre.
space: The district has any service or shop you may desire at a walking distance, many restaurants and clubs as well.  I will be pleased to suggest our best addresses and give you directions to have a very enjoyable journey.  We have 1 separated bedroom and one mezzanine for the second bed. One bathroom is "en suite" to the main bedroom.  Welcome to our beautiful loft! Karine

name: Explore the heart of old Paris
summary: Cozy, well-appointed and graciously designed studio apartment that mixes old and new aesthetics at the very heart of Paris, on the famous Isle St Louis that is a stone's throw from Le Marais, Quartier Latin, Notre Dame and Le Louvre.
space: Small, well appointed studio apartment at the very heart of Paris, on the famous Isle St Louis. FOUR-NIGHT MINIMUM.  We are looking for quiet persons or couples to rent our fully equipped and furnished studio (about 30 square meters or 300 square feet) in central Paris on the famous Isle St. Louis. Please contact us for more information. Discounts available for longer stays. The location is superb. Pick up fresh bread at the nearby boulangerie and some exquisite cheese at the local fromagerie for breakfast. Take a late night stroll along the nearby Seine. Bar hop in the adjacent Marais district, the East Village of Paris.
description: Cozy, well-appointed and graciously designed studio apartment that mixes old and new aesthetics at the very heart of Paris, on the famous Isle St Louis that is a stone's throw from Le Marais, Quartier Latin, Notre Dame and Le Louvre. Small, well appointed studio apartment at the very heart of Paris, on the famous Isle St Louis. FOUR-NIGHT MINIMUM.  We are looking for quiet persons or couples to rent our fully equipped and furnished studio (about 30 square meters or 300 square feet) in central Paris on the famous Isle St. Louis. Please contact us for more information. Discounts available for longer stays. The location is superb. Pick up fresh bread at the nearby boulangerie and some exquisite cheese at the local fromagerie for breakfast. Take a late night stroll along the nearby Seine. Bar hop in the adjacent Marais district, the East Village of Paris. The flat includes its own modern bathroom, a washing machine, stove, oven, toaster and coffee press. For sleeping there is only a fold-o
neighborhood_overview: You are within walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Le Marais, Les Halles, Chatelet, St. Germain, Les Tuileries, le Jardin des Plantes, St. Michel, Sorbonne, Institut du Monde Arab, the Bastille and the Latin Quarter.
notes: The staircase leading up to the apartment is narrow and old -- this is a very old building, so perhaps unsuitable for those with difficulty walking or climbing up stairs.
transit: The flat is close to two or three major metro lines, as well near several of Paris' Velibre stations where you can rent a bike for a small fee.
access: The flat includes its own modern bathroom, a washing machine, stove, oven, toaster and coffee press. For sleeping there is only a fold-out couch but it has a real mattress that's rather comfortable. There is a desk that's excellent for working, bar stools, a fully-equipped kitchenette, television, closet space, wireless broadband internet, towels, linens, pots, pans, plates, forks, knives.  All you need to bring are your clothes and toothbrush. Excellent for visiting scholars, businesspersons or tourists. Absolutely no pets or smoking allowed.
interaction: We expect guests to operate rather independently, though we welcome questions about the flat and urge you to call us immediately if there is any kind of emergency or trouble.
house_rules: This is a small flat in a very old building that we also use when the two of us and our infant daughter come to Paris. We ask that you treat the flat as if it were your own place, and leave it reasonably tidy when you leave. No smoking or pets. Please remember to double lock the door when you step out.
host_about: We are both journalists based in the Middle East, and spend a lot of time traveling for work, so we understand what people need when they're away from home. Delphine is Parisian -- her aunt helps us rent out the apartment. We both love Paris and try to make it easy for people to come and visit the city.

space: PLEASE ASK ME BEFORE TO MAKE A REQUEST !!! No check-in hour: I do my best ! name: Large & sunny flat with balcony !
summary: Very large & nice apartment all for you!  - Sunny living room & bedrooms - Well equiped and furnished - Central location & walking distance to many attractions - Great neighborhood
space: hello ! We have a great 75 square meter apartment in the 9e arrondissement. It is  located on a pedestrian street in vibrant neighborhood. You will enjoy a central location : walking distance to Galeries Lafayettes, les Halles, Opéra Garnier, Montmartre. There are lots of typical shops and restaurants around. I'll be glad to advice you on which one to try according to what you like.  3 very close subway stations : Grands Boulevards, Cadet or Notre-Dame de Lorette. It is on the 5th floor, with no elevator. Very sunny with a long balcony : perfect for breakfast or late drink ! One large bedroom with a queen size bed for 2, one room with a double bed, a large sunny living room (Internet wifi, flat screen TV and DVD player). Fully equiped kitchen (washing machine, dishwasher) ; large bathroom with bath ;  Secure building. Do not hesitate to contact me!

name: GREAT FLAT w/ CITY VIEW
space: Really nice flat located in the 20th district (east) next to the famous Pere Lachaise cimetary (Jim Morrison, Edith Piaf...) with amazing panoramic view over Paris. 7th floor w/ elevator 43 m2, open space living room / bedroom 1 double bed 1 massive couch wich can easely contain one person (or two small ones) 1 kitchen 1 bathroom w/ bathtub 1 dressing room 2 balconies (1 east side over the cimetary park / 1 south side over the city) full of sun all day long, nice for brunch time... Wi-Fi connection. Landline phone with free calls to many other landlines worldwide and free calls to US and Canadian cell phones. Subway station 2 mns walk, going west via center or north (Marais, Opéra, Montmartre Sacré Coeur, Champs Elysées) - Lines 2 and 3. Bus station right in front of the building, going thru the city (Bastille, Marais, Louvre, St Germain, Eiffel Tour) - Line 69. Super market close by. Big commercial street at 5 mn walk. No smoking inside the flat, but you can smoke on the balconies. Am

name: Cozy, Central Paris: WALK or VELIB EVERYWHERE !
summary: Location! Location! Location! Just bring your toothbrush to this charmingly restored cheerful one bedroom in the center of the city. Exposed beams, facing an interior courtyard, walk to the wonderful rue Montorgeuil market: what else could you want? Brand new renovation, electricity upgrade and new carpet this year. Prefer to rent for a minimum of 6 MONTHS (one year is preferred). Monthly rent discount is 1400 euros.
space: Since I live in the USA, it is difficult to manage from here, so I am only considering rentals for SIX MONTHS or longer (1 year preferred). Discount for monthly is 1400 euros per month. My home in Paris is as central as you can get....YOU CAN SAVE MONEY by WALKING to everything so you can eat baguettes and chocolate croissants each day: only 5 minutes to the Centre Pompidou, 3 minutes to the Les Halles RER/metro station, 1 minute to the Chatelet metro stop, 5 minutes to the LATE NIGHT bus stop, 10 minutes to Place St. Michel on the other side of the Seine, 10 minutes to the Louvre, 15 minutes to the heart of the old Jewish quarter, Le Marais, 30 minutes to Place des Vosges or St. Germain des Pres, about 30 minutes promenade to galleries in La Bastille, 15 minutes to Notre Dame and the island....you are as central as you can get! My charming apartment is on the fifth floor facing an interior courtyard on one of the busiest streets in Paris, rue St. Denis. There is the Australian bar, OZ

transit: All the major metros and RERs are at Les Halles or Chatelet. Very easy to arrive and the night buses are also nearby at Hotel de Ville, 5 minutes away walking. Velib in front of building!
access: You are alone in the flat, the entire city is at your feet. You will enjoy being able to go outside and be astonished at the liveliness of the area and then come back home and it's facing two courtyards so there is a calm which helps make being in the center attractive.
interaction: I am available 18 hours a day by text, have lots of friends (and friendly neighbors) in Paris available to help answer any questions. It's easy to rent with me. Like having your family flat for your personal use!
house_rules: This residence is limited to TWO people and is for a MINIMUM rental of SIX MONTHS.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
I am a Native New Yorker (yes, I was born and raised here!) and have lived in Boston, Paris and Los Angeles and speak a bit of French and Spanish and about two words of Italian. I work in the legal field. I went to culinary school to study pastry many years ago and now I just bake cookies at Christmas when I have the time!

I have traveled to over 60 countries, go away to my house in Pennsylvania on many weekends and like meeting new people. 

As to the listings on AIRBNB: I have one "Supersize Studio" on the Upper East Side, which is a walk-up and has no doorman and I do not live there. The building is approximately 50 years old. The entire apartment is at your disposal. There is a queen sized bed, a table and chairs and it is perfect for a sole occupant needing a home-away-from-home. It is in Yorkville, home of the old Austrian and Hungarian and German bakeries, long gone. On Saturdays, at Saint Stephen's, which is opposite the apartment, there is a market which is wonderful. Otherwise, you have more than enough small cute places  to eat and hang out and if you are a couple of young single people, all the bars and restaurants you might want to go to until closing are on Second Avenue, one block over. This apartment is a very large studio with high ceilings and faces north to a garden, which is quiet. It comes with linens and dishes and has a small kitchen. There is a $60 cleaning fee and a $500security deposit required. AIRBNB collects the security and I ask you pre-pay the cleaning fee on arrival in cash.

So as to avoid confusion, the second listing, "Paris in New York" location is my home and about which I speak below and this is the apartment which has been reviewed the most. I no longer allow it to be rented.

I traveled to Europe the first time on my own via SERVAS many years ago and have not forgotten the kindness of the people I met then. I hope to reciprocate and make new friends!

Please contact me if you are interested in staying at one of my places. You MUST be a non-smoker but smoking is allowed in front of the building outside if you are desperate.

Please have your profile here. It is easier if I know  something about who you are, where you live and what you do. If I don't know something about you, it's hard for me to answer a request to stay quickly, since I like to have a level of comfort renting.

I've known one friend who lives in Abu Dhabi who I met via SERVAS over 30 years now. I expect to know my AirBNB guests just as long!

Thanks for your interest!

As to the other listings: the apartment in Paris (Chatelet) is not available again until 2015.  It is rented a minimum of six months. The apartment in Hossegor, in the Southwest of France, is available off-season each year from October until May. 

The Victorian house in northeast Pennsylvania is available on select weeks if you are interested in skiing at Elk Mountain, which is 20 minutes up the hill on Route 106 from Carbondale.

Just ask me!

name: Paris petit coin douillet
space: Make your stay in Paris a perfect experience. Our spacious, very French apartements are located in the pleasant 11th Ardonissement just near the Marais between Republique and Bastille. Just 5 minutes from the Picasso Museum, the area has a delightful market, delightful cafés and restaurants. The metro is at your doorstep and it is a pleasant stroll through the Marais down to the river Seine.  The apartment is provided with a computer for email access, a well-equiped kitchen, a double bed, and authentic french furnishings. You will also enjoy the nearby fresh market on Boulevard Richard lenoir with typical French vegetables and fruits in season, fish, meat and many other local produce. Strolling down to Bastille, you can board the wonderful cruises at the Bassin de l'Arsenal right below the Bastille. This will take you on the Canal Saint Martin and below the street level, on to the Parc de La Vilette.

access: Cet appartement n est pas accessible aux Handicapés.. logement ancien et petit...
host_about:
Parisienne retraitée, dynamique et accueillante, Elisabeth vous attend dans son petit nid au coeur des quartiers animés de Bastille et de République plein de restaurants typiques .Vous y serez "at home" avec toutes les facilités pour un séjour "cosy".
A deux pas du Marais, vous pourrez le parcourir à pied facilement, de belles promenades en perspective....
Elisabeth, a true parisian, dynamic and welcoming, is expecting you in her "nest" in Bastille and République busy area, full of typical restaurants. You will feel at home in her cosy place. Within a walking distance from the Marais district, a lot of "promenades" to enjoy...

name: Paris view from my balcony - B&B
summary: A real "home from home" in the heart of Paris for up to 4 people (5 with a folding bed)  in an authentic Haussmann apartment with a large balcony.  Close to the main centres of (Website hidden by Airbnb) ideal way to enjoy this fantastic city in complete freedom.
space: Enjoy a slice of Parisian history and stay in an authentic Haussmann apartment. Sleeping up to five people, it is a charming apartment (50 m²) with parquet floors, mouldings and a fireplace with two adjoining bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen and a large balcony decorated with flowers. On the 5th floor without a lift, appreciate the clear view of Paris and get excited by how central this apartment is to so many attractions. A short walk away are three Metro stations with numerous connections to the main line RER, airport, taxi and bus stations nearby. The movida room : An association of clear bright colours lightens this room with a design decoration just a touch psychedelic to recall the sensual and slightly kitsch ambiance of the films of Pedro Almodovar....But it’s only an unpretentious nod and a wink !  Associated with an old fashioned setting of mouldings, parquet floor and fireplace the overall effect comes across as rather appealing... judge for yourself. With it’s two single b

Close to the main centres of (Website hidden by Airbnb) ideal way to enjoy this fantastic city in complete freedom. Enjoy a slice of Parisian history and stay in an authentic Haussmann apartment. Sleeping up to five people, it is a charming apartment (50 m²) with parquet floors, mouldings and a fireplace with two adjoining bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen and a large balcony decorated with flowers. On the 5th floor without a lift, appreciate the clear view of Paris and get excited by how central this apartment is to so many attractions. The movida room : An association of clear bright colours lightens this room with a design decoration just a touch psychedelic to recall the sensual and slightly kitsch ambiance
neighborhood_overview: This area typically Parisian, is nice, trendy and popular with, near the rue Oberkampf and its restaurants, bars, shops ... what to spend your evenings in the festive atmosphere. Also near the City Hall and the Marais district, the oldest district of Paris is also known for its "gay life". Still near the Canal Saint Martin now so characteristic of "Paris bobo" or you end up on Sunday for a picnic with friends, rollerblading or cycling ... Canal where you can also navigate a real curiosity The boulevard that stretches from the Place de la Bastille to the canal Saint Martin passing under your balcony gives oxygen and greenery with tall trees and colorful flower beds. It is also a lively area with the market very closeby (every Tuesday and Friday morning), its flea markets, and petanque players place. Near the apartment many shops, supermarkets, restaurants, bars, theaters, discos, cultural sites, services ... You can move by feet or by public transport and easy access to all tourist attr
notes: We participated in the very beginning of the Airbnb'adventure  in Paris in 2009 and I had the pleasure to spend a day with Joe, one of the founders, who photographed the apartment by himself. I doubt he does that again today !!! I keep a very pleasant memory of this day and I am admiring the way traveled by Airbnb with whom I hope to continue a long way.
transit: I can also organize transport service.Easy access from the train stations and airports. I am in contact with you as soon as your booking is made and I provide you with accurate information access to the apartment. One minute to metro station Saint Ambroise line 9 makes traveling by metro very easy. Many connections with the main axes RER, SNCF, Airports ... Taxi and Bus Station nearby. Bike rental, the Vélibs so pleasant  ...
access: Services and equipment :  free wireless internet high speed, ADSL, large LCD TV, DVD, free phone to numerous countries, bed linen and towels, hairdryer, safe box, baby cot, stroller, equipped kitchen, dishes, small and large appliances including dishwasher...).  Breakfast is provided on a do it yourself basis (tea, coffee, drinking chocolate, milk, orange juice, toast bread, brioche, butter, “home-made” jam, cereals, yoghurts). Guides and city maps are also available.
interaction: I welcome you personally on your arrival, I give you all the useful information to make the most of the apartment and its facilities and I give you the services and shops of the neighborhood. Throughout your stay you can ask me because I live next door.
house_rules: You are feeling free in your home away from home.  The occupation of the apartment must be respecting the neighbors.  Information to become familiar with the apartment and its surroundings will be given on arrival. We are closeby for the duration of your stay to assist you if necessary. We are happy to help you if you need assistance (need to print documents, book a tour or a show, call for a taxi...) . It is forbidden to smoke in the apartment but smoking is permitted on the balcony
host_about: Welcome in Paris! I enjoy traveling and sharing my insider tips about Paris. I have traveled Australia, South America, US, Asia,  Egypt, Africa, Europe,..... and I am one of the very first Airbnb host in Paris!

name: Be charmed by real Paris 11th - B&B
summary: Here you will find a true home from home in Paris so that the Parisian lifestyle will feel part of yours. We will welcome you for a short or medium stay for Bed & Breakfast with the never ending pleasure of sharing Paris with you. Close to metro.
space: Here you will find a true home from home so that the Parisian lifestyle will feel part of yours.The apartment is situated on the second floor (without a lift) of this three floored building. The low rise nature of the building gives it a human dimension much appreciated and rare in the heart of the Capital. The apartment has a kitchen/diner, a living room with a double sofa bed, a bedroom with 2 single beds (which can be put together to make a double bed), and a bathroom. The apartment has been entirely renovated and has been redecorated by ourselves in a ‘seventies style…..We’ve put a lot of enthusiasm into it and we hope you’ll love it. The building, built in the eighteenth century, was not originally residential but built to house metal-working facilities in a working class neighbourhood of the Capital. This activity has given the name to the “Passage de Fonderie (Foundry Passage)” that leads to the building. This preserved passageway has kept all of it’s charm with it’s cobbles, th

Many connections with the main axes RER, SNCF, Airports ... Taxi and Bus Station nearby. Bike rental, the Vélibs so pleasant  ...
access: The price includes : Breakfast provided to prepare yourself freely (tea, coffee, hot chocolate, milk, orange juice, toast bread, brioche, butter, home-made jam, cereals, yoghurt…)  fresh bedding and bath towels  maid service at the end of the stay  use of all available facilities (internet high speed, Wi-Fi access, TV with many international channels, DVD player, free phone to many countries)  baby cot, safe box, choice of DVD’s, maps and guides of Paris...
interaction: I welcome you personally upon arrival, I give you all the information to get the most of the apartment and its facilities and I tell you the services and boutiques in the area. All through your stay you can ask me because I live nearby.
house_rules: When you are in this apartment and you are home free. Obviously you must respect the place and the neighbors On arrival I will give you some guidelines so that all goes well and you will soon feel at home. That's what all the people who have stayed there say. We live 5 minutes away and we are easily reachable by phone. We can easily respond to any problems, breakdown or if you need assistance (need to print documents, book a tour or a show, call for a taxi...) It is forbidden to smoke in the apartment
host_about: Welcome in Paris! I enjoy traveling and sharing my insider tips about Paris. I have traveled Australia, South America, US, Asia,  Egypt, Africa, Europe,..... and I am one of the very first Airbnb host in Paris!

name: Montmartre Studio 7
summary: LONG TERM RENTAL Available  The studio is situated on a quiet street and is located on the 4th floor of a 1970’s French apartment building which has a lift and a coded entry.
space: The studio is an open living space measuring 200 square feet. Can accommodate two persons (four persons - for short periods).  The sleeping arrangements include one double sized bed and one sleeper sofa. Smoking is not allowed and sorry no pets. The kitchenette is open and is equipped with a multi-function microwave, small fridge, coffee maker, electric kettle, toaster, portable double stovetop and all cooking utensils necessary. The bathroom is fitted with a shower, toilet, sink and washing machine (+ a drying-rack tower). One set of towels and bed linens are provided during your visit. A hairdryer is also available (one less thing to pack).    950 euros = Monthly rate The rental fee includes taxes and charges, such as electric, water, DSL internet hookup and telephone. Security/Damage:  800€ Security/Damage deposit is due at check-in and will be returned at check-out.
description: LONG TERM RENTAL Available  The studio is situated on a quiet street and is located on the 4th floor of a 1970’s French apartment building which has a lift and a coded entry. The studio is an open living space measuring 200 square feet. Can accommodate two persons (four persons - for short periods).  The sleeping arrangements include one double sized bed and one sleeper sofa. Smoking is not allowed and sorry no pets. The kitchenette is open and is equipped with a multi-function microwave, small fridge, coffee maker, electric kettle, toaster, portable double stovetop and all cooking utensils necessary. The bathroom is fitted with a shower, toilet, sink and washing machine (+ a drying-rack tower). One set of towels and bed linens are provided during your visit. A hairdryer is also available (one less thing to pack).    950 euros = Monthly rate The rental fee includes taxes and charges, such as electric, water, DSL internet hookup and telephone. Security/Damage:  800€ Security/Damage depo
neighborhood_overview: Montmartre, the neighborhood surrounding the studio, maintains its physical charm and the village atmosphere remains remarkably intact. True montmartrians however, use their feet to visit the area. This is the perfect way to enjoy the unique architecture of the area: there are tiny exquisite squares, wooden houses, hidden parks, winding streets, small terraces and long stairways plus the Butte’s famous vineyard.  Many shops and stores are close to the apartment: bakery, butcher, supermarkets, restaurants, cafes, clubs, laundromats, and doctors.
transit: The studio can be easily accessed by the RER, Metro, bus or taxi from Charles De Gaule airport or any Paris train station (if traveling to Paris by train from another European destination). Detail information will be provided to you prior to your arrival via email or fax. METRO:  Métro station Château Rouge (line 4), Marcadet-Poissonniers (line4) or Jules Joffrin (line 12) are just a 10-15 minutes walk away.  BUS:  Bus n°85 goes to the center of Paris Châtelet, Les Halles (many shops) and Le Louvre, Luxembourg garden.  Bus n° 80 goes to Place de Clichy (Pathé Cinéma theatre, restaurants...), Saint-Lazarre station, the Champs Elysées, Pont d'Alma, the Eiffel Tower.  The Montmartrobus is a fantastic way to get around Montmartre (Sacré-Coeur, Place du Tertre, Pigalle) without exhausting yourself climbing up and down those hills! BIKES: You can also find bike stands: Vélib’ which is a self service 'bike hire' system available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Multi pick up and drop off locati
access: There is a phone with free calls in France and free calls for abroad (for some countries, ask for more details). You also have an internet connection (wifi or USB cable), television, DVD player (Zone 2: will not play US DVDs), iron and ironing board, closet space as well as a small table and four chairs.
host_about:
Licensed California Architect living in Paris
I am a AIA member

Feel free to contact me If you have any questions

name: Calm  place in a "bourgeois" area !
space: Very close to Place de la Concorde and Madeleine Church, the apartment is Located in a very quiet residential area.  It has been recently renovated. You Will find a modern equipment in the living-room as well as in the kitchen.  The flat is very functional and colorful decorated.  The Bedroom includes a mezzanine with a double bed + (in the living room there is a sofa for 2 persons).  Living-room with an integrated American kitchen:  Flat TV with cable (many channels),  A DVD player,  A telephone: you can call for free in many Countries,  A Internet  with Wi-Fi The  fully equipped Kitchen: ceram 2 hotplates, microwave, toaster, washing-drying machine, fridge-freezer, etc. ...  Bathroom: toilet with integrated shower.  No lift 5th floor! ... Because you must deserve it!  The location of the flat is very central, very close to the beautiful Parc Monceau,  Shopping facilities, in 2min walking distance. Great public transportations: 5 min by foot to the metro station "Europe" (line 3)/ Wal
